entry.title: Palace (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the early 20th century, "playing the Palace" (interior pictured) was said to mark the pinnacle of a vaudeville entertainer's career?

entry.title: Erdowie, Erdowo, Erdogan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Turkish government tried to have the German music video "Erdowie, Erdowo, Erdogan" taken down because it insulted Turkish president Recep Tayyip Erdoğan?

entry.title: Courtenay Edward Stevens (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that it was British classicist Courtenay Edward Stevens who suggested that Allied radio broadcasts during the Second World War use the opening notes of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony as a signature theme?

entry.title: Fuchs Mizrachi School (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that students and faculty from Fuchs Mizrachi School protested at Nazi guard John Demjanjuk's home in 1993, objecting to his release from Israeli prison and residence in the United States?

entry.title: Ask la Cour (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ask la Cour, who came from Denmark, only planned to perform with the New York City Ballet for a few years, but spent two decades there and became a principal dancer?

entry.title: geography (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that glaciation in Wisconsin 17 thousand years ago helped create its unique geography?

entry.title: Gaudelia Díaz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Gaudelia Díaz won a bronze medal at the 1992 Paralympics, she was asked to join Televisa by its CEO?

entry.title: Boston, Barre and Gardner Railroad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Boston, Barre and Gardner Railroad never actually reached Boston or Barre?
